intro: Malvastrum splendidum, commonly known as the showy mallows, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is characterized by its large, showy pink to red flowers that bloom in summer. The plant has heart-shaped leaves with a fuzzy texture and is often found in rocky soils and open habitats. It is a member of the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. Malvastrum splendidum is valued in gardens for its ornamental appeal and ability to attract pollinators.
